variables.name: Intensity Sum Normalised per Nucleus
variables.desc: For each image, each object, each channel, the Intensity Sum of the object is divided by the Intensity Sum in the Surface "Nucleus"

variables.name: Intensity Mean Normalised per Nucleus
variables.desc: For each image, each object, each channel, the Intensity Mean of the object is divided by the Intensity Mean in the Surface "Nucleus"

variables.name: Intensity StdDev Normalised per Nucleus
variables.desc: For each image, each object, each channel, the Intensity StdDev of the object is divided by the Intensity StdDev in the Surface "Nucleus"

variables.name: Intensity Sum Normalised by Group
variables.desc: For each object, each channel, the Intensity Sum is divided by the Group Intensity Sum

variables.name: Intensity Mean Normalised by Group
variables.desc: For each object, each channel, the Intensity Mean is divided by the Group Intensity Mean

variables.name: Intensity StdDev Normalised by Group
variables.desc: For each object, each channel, the Intensity StdDev is divided by the Group Intensity StdDev

variables.name: Ratio of Intensity Sum
variables.desc: For each object, the ratio is made between the values: Intensity Sum

variables.name: Ratio of Intensity Mean
variables.desc: For each object, the ratio is made between the values: Intensity Mean

variables.name: Ratio of Intensity Sum Normalised per Nucleus
variables.desc: For each object, the ratio is made between the values: Intensity Sum Normalized per Nucleus

variables.name: Ratio of Intensity Sum Normalised by Group
variables.desc: For each object, the ratio is made between the values: Intensity Sum Normalized by Group

variables.name: Normalized Distance to Nucleus
variables.desc: For each image, the shortest distance of the spot = "Nucleus Center Of Mass" to the surface = "Nucleus" is taken as a reference distance
variables.comment: SHOULD BE Distance Normalized per Nucleus

variables.name: Surface Area-to-Volume Ratio
variables.desc: Per object, the surface is divided by the volume

variables.name: Volume Relative to Nucleus
variables.desc: Per object, the volume is divided by the volume of the Surface=Nucleus in the same image

variables.name: Volume Relative to Group
variables.desc: Per object, the Volume is divided by the Group Volume in the same image

variables.name: Object Count
variables.desc: Description comes
variables.comment: SHOULD BE Object Count per Group

variables.name: Group Intensity Sum
variables.desc: For a given group of objects carrying the same name, the Intensity Sums are added up (Sum of Intensity Sum)

variables.name: Group Intensity Mean
variables.desc: For a given group of objects carrying the same name, the Intensity Means are averaged (Mean of Intensity Mean)

variables.name: Group Intensity Sum Relative to Nucleus
variables.desc: This variable requires the "Group Intensity Sum" and a reference surface, "Nucleus". For each object, each channel, the Group Intensity Sum is divided by the Intensity Sum in the Nucleus. This variable expresses the relative fraction of signal in a group of segmented objects relative to the total signal in the reference surface, "Nucleus"

variables.name: Group Intensity Mean Relative to Nucleus
variables.desc: This variable requires the "Group Intensity Mean" and a reference surface, "Nucleus". For each object, each channel, the Group Intensity Mean is divided by the Intensity Mean in the Nucleus. This variable expresses the relative density of the signal in a group of segmented objects relative to the density overall in the reference surface, "Nucleus"

variables.name: Group Volume
variables.desc: Per image, the volumes of objects belonging to the same group, same image, are summed up

variables.name: Group Surface Area
variables.desc: The surface of objects belonging to the same group, same image, are summed up

variables.name: Group Volume Relative to Nucleus
variables.desc: This variable requires the "Group Volume" variable. The Group Volume is divided by the volume of the Surface=Nucleus in the same image

variables.name: Group Surface Area-to-Volume Ratio
variables.desc: This variable requires the variables "Group Surface" and "Group Volume". Per group of object, the "Group Surface" is divided by the "Group Volume"

variables.name: Signal Density
variables.desc: Description comes
